snippet.textDisplay: ...Soooooo are the birds and regis different Pokémon? Because if they're region variants that puts holes all over the Pokémon mythos, not to mention at that point why are they even called Regirock, Ice, and Steel if they aren't those types anymore? Does this mean there are multiple legendaries? If so that's a terrible idea, maybe if you restrict it to minor ones like the bird trio, but don't go doing it to the beast trio or lake trio. Ho-Oh revived only 3 Pokémon from that burning tower, there shouldn't be multiples of them, and giving them new types (outside of ice for suicune because it already looks like one) defeats the purpose of their creation, they were born from lightning, fire and water, lightning hit the tower, it burned killing them, and the rain put it out, they were born from the ashes and these specific elements. The lake trio or any of the creation Pokémon for that matter, does that mean someone like Cyrus could have 100 of each lake guardian, 20 Dialga, 50 Giratina, and 13 Palkia? Could you imagine the universe ending and bending he could do with that power? What about the Tapus that are only suppose to be on Alola because they're the guardians of Alola. All I'm saying is think carefully before you proceed with any of these things, you are breaking the fabric of your own mythos if you aren't careful gamefreak.
snippet.textOriginal: ...Soooooo are the birds and regis different Pokémon? Because if they're region variants that puts holes all over the Pokémon mythos, not to mention at that point why are they even called Regirock, Ice, and Steel if they aren't those types anymore? Does this mean there are multiple legendaries? If so that's a terrible idea, maybe if you restrict it to minor ones like the bird trio, but don't go doing it to the beast trio or lake trio. Ho-Oh revived only 3 Pokémon from that burning tower, there shouldn't be multiples of them, and giving them new types (outside of ice for suicune because it already looks like one) defeats the purpose of their creation, they were born from lightning, fire and water, lightning hit the tower, it burned killing them, and the rain put it out, they were born from the ashes and these specific elements. The lake trio or any of the creation Pokémon for that matter, does that mean someone like Cyrus could have 100 of each lake guardian, 20 Dialga, 50 Giratina, and 13 Palkia? Could you imagine the universe ending and bending he could do with that power? What about the Tapus that are only suppose to be on Alola because they're the guardians of Alola. All I'm saying is think carefully before you proceed with any of these things, you are breaking the fabric of your own mythos if you aren't careful gamefreak.

snippet.textDisplay:
Gotta catch em all, more like gotta buy em all, why does everyone think they need to jump on the DLC train, it's greedy and stupid. If done right DLC is fine, it can be amazing, but 30$ for barely any content, most of it just being old Pokémon being brought back, that's not worth 20 let alone 30$. Shovel Knight one of the best games of last decade, what made it better was free DLC, as long as you had the original game 1st back when it came out you got 3 campaigns aside from the base game, 3 unique play styles, they were through the same levels and world, but were crafted and altered to fit the new characters making them fresh and new, they were just as long if not longer, and just as fun if not way more fun than the original. Gender swap and a new battle mode in the style of smash bros also free, and even if you missed out on that deal getting the game now it's still what 15-20$ more for 4 times the content? Shantae did exactly the same with it's last game, it provided more than 5 times the gameplay with new characters or alterations that made the play through unique only for 10$ more, base game is 20, ultimate is 30$. the equivalent price range for this Pokémon DLC is as much as Pokémon Silver, Gold, and Crystal were back in the day, games that were twice the size of the 1st generation, provided twice as much content, and for the same price of 30$ as the 1st generation games.

This is robbery, 30$ is too much for this stuff on a game nobody like, even if it sold well doesn't mean people like it, and you expect us to buy it because you are working off our crutch of we gotta catch em all because you created that concept for the games back in the beginning. People were complaining about dex cuts and bad graphics back when only the 1st trailer dropped, that was nothing compared to this, I was fine with no national dex, I don't use the old Pokémon anyways, if I want to I can go back and play the games they came from. Most of the complainers were people that did competitive, but Pokémon isn't a competitive game, it never has been, but even the company now thinks we suddenly need to make it competitive. Pokémon while it has competition has never been about that, the core premise is about adventure and collecting, like the creator did when he was a child collecting bugs, it's always been about that. With Sword and Shield you ruined that, heck you even butchered the story, who the hell saves the villain reveal till right before the credits role? That's what you did, you never do that in any form of entertainment that's God awful, there was no build up, there was no story development, yes we knew who the villains were be because it's predictable but there were no hints to it until right before the Champion battle. After this game's equivalent to elite 4, and right before the champion battle, the champion signifies the end of the game, it's the ultimate goal and the strongest trainer, but you interrupted that, you pulled us out of the moment and force us to go do this task. At that point it's just a chore that we groan about because we don't want to do that, we were busy and in the middle of another thing, that's terrible story writing.

What was the point of that rant, because I enjoyed the game up until that point, everyone was judging it on "bad graphics" and the lack of a national dex, those were menial arguments, judgement people made and refused to buy the game for because of that despite not experiencing the actual game itself. What I did was made an actual reason for why this game is bad, there are many other reasons, but that was my biggest. Four of my others would be lack of a GTS, raid battles, the pandering to gen 1 AGAIN for the 7th year in a row, and how you handled the legendary. The cpus suck for raid battles, and I hate playing stuff with other people, it's impossible to fight a 5 star raid battle on your own without real humans that have brains. I love Charizard, but holy crap KNOCK OFF THE GEN 1 PANDERING you're making me hate my favorite Pokémon because he has too many forms and is getting too much pandering, what about Typhlosion, 20th anniversary to gen 2, you've done absolutely nothing with those mon since the remakes what 10 years ago? Re release of the originals was cool, but come on, same with gens 4 and 5. Making the 3rd legendary a guaranteed catch and you catch it in the main game (again after interrupting the story that was already in progress), but the box legendaries are post game, why not make all legendaries post game?

You are ruining my childhood, a game series I've stuck with since the very beginning, one after another with the screw ups, all I have to say is there better be no sequel game to Sword and Shield, or a cannon version, because then people will truly riot, a 60$ Pokémon game when they've only ever been 30-40, plus 30 DLC, and another 60$ game that has little to no additions, that would be awful.

snippet.authorDisplayName: Diabolus Rex The Vyond YouTuber Fan 2019
snippet.textDisplay: My doggo Lycanroc returns! If they decide to do the version exclusive thing with Rockruff's evolutions again, here is what I predict, Lycanroc Midday Form in Pokemon Sword, Lycanroc Midnight Form in Pokemon Shield, Dawn Form in Sword and Dusk Form in Shield (If they add a Dawn Form but if they do, they might just do Dusk and Dawn in both versions). This may not be true but I can see GameFreak slightly hinting at a Dawn Form for Lycanroc because if you play Sword and Shield in the early morning, you can see a sunrise in the sky (the sunrise did not happen in Ultra Sun and Moon, they only had the Midday, Midnight and Dusk Forms), same as if you play the games during sunset, you would then see the sunset in the games. Again, this is what could happen but isn't guaranteed to happen.

Again, this is what could happen but isn't guaranteed to happen.
